title: (x) Baskin Robbins logo - (similar to) ITC Garamond {Mark S}
content:
Can anyone tell me the font used in the old Baskin Robbins logo? Including the font in the #31.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20090414111322im_/http:/www.typophile.com/files/baskin%20robbins.gif)
author: mark42267

comments.content: I believe it’s based on [ITC Garamond Condensed](http://web.archive.org/web/20090414111322/http:/www.fontshop.com/index.cfm?fuseaction=catalog.fontpackage&startrow=1&records=&currpage=1&totalrecords=8&displayfontid=ITC.119135.0.0&fontRendererText=Baskin+31+Robbins), but appears to be modified somewhat.

I suspect that, like most logos, this is custom lettering, but you could approximate this with Scangraphic’s [’Times Black’](http://web.archive.org/web/20090414111322/http:/www.fontshop.com/index.cfm?fuseaction=catalog.fontdetail&displayfontid=SG.102124.0.1&attributes.sampleSize=48&sampleText=Baskin+Robbins&sampleSize=32) and a bit of ’squooshing’. The x-height is nearly as high, and the letterforms are pretty close, in my opinon. The ’3’ has even the right attributes, if you distort it some.

- Mike Yanega

OK, now I see Mark’s choice. I agree with Stephen — Mark is righter.

- Mike Yanega
